---
title: Fullstack Todo Template
description: React + Node.js Todo app template with MongoDB for local development
---

# Fullstack Todo Template

The Fullstack Todo template provides a production-ready React + Node.js application. Local development now uses MongoDB via Mongoose.

## Stack

- Frontend: React 18, Vite, Ant Design, Tailwind CSS
- Backend: Node.js (Express), JWT auth
- Database (local): MongoDB (Mongoose)

## Local Development

### Prerequisites

- Node.js 18+
- Docker (to run MongoDB locally) or a local MongoDB server

### Start MongoDB

```bash
docker run -d --name todoapp-mongo -p 27017:27017 \
  -e MONGO_INITDB_ROOT_USERNAME=root \
  -e MONGO_INITDB_ROOT_PASSWORD=example \
  mongo:7
```

### Environment Variables (Backend)

File: `golden-path/templates/fullstack-todo/backend/.env`

```bash
JWT_SECRET=dev-secret-change-me
PORT=5000
NODE_ENV=development
FRONTEND_URL=http://localhost:5174
MONGO_URI=mongodb://root:example@localhost:27017/todoapp?authSource=admin
```

> Note: For a MongoDB server without authentication, you can use:
> `MONGO_URI=mongodb://localhost:27017/todoapp`

### Run Backend

```bash
cd golden-path/templates/fullstack-todo/backend
npm install
npm start
```

Health endpoint: `http://localhost:5000/health`

### Run Frontend

```bash
cd golden-path/templates/fullstack-todo/frontend
npm install
npm run dev -- --port 5174
```

App: `http://localhost:5174`

### API Proxy

The frontend proxies API requests to the backend via Vite `vite.config.js`:

```js
server: {
  proxy: {
    '/api': { target: 'http://localhost:5000', changeOrigin: true }
  }
}
```

## Authentication

- Register: `POST /api/auth/register`
- Login: `POST /api/auth/login`

Store the returned JWT in `localStorage` (handled by the template). Requests include `Authorization: Bearer <token>`.

## Todos API

- GET `/api/todos?filter=all|completed|pending`
- POST `/api/todos` { title, description? }
- PUT `/api/todos/:id` { title?, description?, completed? }
- DELETE `/api/todos/:id`

## Production Notes

- Use a managed MongoDB (e.g., MongoDB Atlas) or adapt to RDS/PostgreSQL if preferred.
- Configure secrets via your cloud secret manager.
